intro: Trianthema parvifolium, commonly known as the small-leaved trianthema, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows in sandy or rocky soils. The plant features small, narrow leaves and produces clusters of yellow flowers. It is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. The species is part of the Aizoaceae family, known for its succulent characteristics and adaptations to dry climates.
